comments.body: Hi @KonstantinKai! Could you please add some test to barcode contants like this: https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/23800/commits/aad5917ce91360ecb058f2a3df86eb1b7330ad1f#diff-ce63b1202c4c1465b03481d17acd30eaR210?
Could you please add `SvgProps` interface here
What do you think about specify the type of that `object` (e.g.  `string | { translateX?: number, translateY?: number }`)

I'm just using the string variant transform="..." myself, so I would like to leave that as just "|object" for now. You can also do transform="skewX(30)" etc, and there is an equivalent in the object syntax as well so just doing ```{ translateX?: number, translateY?: number }``` wouldn't be entirely correct. To refine the object into a more specific type I would have to dig into exactly what members are available on the react-native-svg objects. I suspect it's scale,rotation,skew etc.

`object` is ok for now. 
A reference from a different package:

https://github.com/svgdotjs/svg.js/blob/master/svg.js.d.ts#L909
I like that you have extracted these into interfaces. üëç
I think it would be nice to include the documentation from expo here in the file, as it has been done in other areas in here.
Just to make sure I understand you correctly: what you meant is to copy the docs from docs.expo.io into a comment (`/** ... */`), right?
@janaagaard75 I don't see any example of documentation pasted from expo.io. And for this function itself, there is a LOT of text to be copied and pasted... Not sure if that's what we want
@janaagaard75 do you mean for this specific method or above the whole section?

Yes, I meant copying the docs from docs.expo.io into `/** ... */ comments and/or writing a better comments where we can. I can see that this has only been done in a few places - the `Calendar` is one example.

And yes, I think this should be done for the whole section.

I should have stressed that this is definitely a nice to have. I you don't have the time to implement this, @burtek, or don't think that we should do this, then don't bother. Having correct typedefs is much more important.
Maybe next time, it would be a little too much time consuming now.
It seems to me that there isn't really any natural way to sort these functions. How about sorting them alphabetically?
@janaagaard75  It's in the order from expo docs. I can sort them any other way if you prefer.
IMO, Expo docs it a great order. This way, it will easier for a user to orientate in both of docs and types.
I hadn't caught that, @burtek. And I agree that keeping the same order as the Expo documentation is better than sorting alphabetically.
